utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What comes to mind when you think about oat milk?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: I does not taste like real milk

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What else do you notice about oat milk when you use it?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: It is a bit watery

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What other things do you notice about oat milk compared to regular milk?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: Nothing really, i do not use it

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What made you try oat milk in the first place if you don't use it now?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: i was looking for an alternative, because regular milk is a bit heavy on my stomach

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What other alternatives have you considered besides oat milk?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: nothing else, i like to add milk froth to my coffee

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What else do you look for when choosing what to add to your coffee?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: I only add milk froth

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What else matters to you about your coffee experience beyond the milk froth?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: flavour taste and caffeine strength

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What else about your coffee experience is important to you besides the flavour, strength, and milk froth?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: that it is smooth and uninterrupted

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What other aspects of your coffee ritual or routine matter to you?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: I prefer to drink coffee in a calm atmosphere

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What else contributes to making your coffee experience feel right for you?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: that i feel energised by it#

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What other things about your coffee experience stand out to you or make it meaningful?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: if it helps me to start the day well and be my best during the day

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What else matters to you when you think about your coffee experience?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: nothing really

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: You mentioned earlier that you feel energized by your coffee - are there any other feelings or experiences that coffee brings you throughout your day?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: Feeling that i am focused and doing my best

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What else does feeling focused and doing your best enable you to do or experience in your life?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: I feel that I set positive example and inspire others

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: Beyond inspiring others and setting an example, what other aspects of your life does this sense of doing your best touch or influence?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: nothing else

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: Let me take a step back - when you think about the whole experience of drinking coffee, what other positive things come to mind that we haven't talked about yet?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: nothing else

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What about the actual moments when you're drinking your coffee - is there anything about those moments themselves that matters to you?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: nothing else

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: Looking at the bigger picture of your life, beyond coffee itself - what other things help you feel like you're doing your best and setting that positive example?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: nothing else

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: When you think about the different parts of your day or week, what other moments give you that same sense of satisfaction that you're living according to what matters to you?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: when i read book to my kids

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: What is it about reading to your kids that gives you that feeling?

utterances.speaker: user
utterances.text: i help them to grow

utterances.speaker: system
utterances.text: Thank you for sharing your thoughts with me today. This has been very helpful.

nodes.label: does not taste like real milk
helps me start the day well
be my best during the day

recommendations.issue: Strategy tracking is broken - always shows recent_uses: 0
recommendations.detail: StrategyDiversityScorer consistently reports 'recent_uses': 0 throughout the entire session, indicating strategy history is not being tracked or persisted. This causes the system to repeatedly select the same 'broaden' strategy without any diversity consideration.
recommendations.fix: FIXED: Added GraphState.add_strategy_used() method and call it in StrategySelectionStage.process() after strategy selection. This persists strategy history to graph_state.properties['strategy_history'] which StrategyDiversityScorer reads to enforce variety. See commits: knowledge_graph.py (add_strategy_used method), strategy_selection_stage.py (tracking call), test_models.py (4 new tests), test_strategy_diversity_scorer.py (7 new tests).

recommendations.issue: Exhaustion signals ignored for 5 consecutive turns
recommendations.detail: User responded with 'nothing really' or 'nothing else' on turns 12, 15, 16, 17, and 18, yet the system continued asking the same type of 'What else' questions. Only on turn 19 did the system finally discover new information (reading to kids) by pure persistence, not adaptive strategy.
recommendations.fix: PARTIALLY FIXED: KnowledgeCeilingScorer handles 'don't know' with LLM enhancement, but does NOT track consecutive exhaustion or force strategy change. Bead interview-system-v2-m4i created for full fix: detect 3+ consecutive exhaustion and force strategy to synthesis/laddering/broaden.

recommendations.detail: The system asked 10 variations of 'What else'/'What other'/'What else about' questions throughout the session. Despite semantic variations, these are structurally identical and caused user fatigue as evidenced by declining richness_score (0.33  0.10) and momentum (50  15).
recommendations.fix: STILL REAL: Question prompts still use 'what else' as primary probe style. Bead interview-system-v2-663 created to add counter-mechanism and expand template diversity (deepen/ladder/connect/reflect).

recommendations.issue: Breadth calculation stuck at 0.0% throughout session
recommendations.detail: DepthBreadthBalanceScorer consistently reports 'breadth_pct': 0.0% from turn 1 through turn 20, despite 18 distinct nodes being created across multiple domains (oat milk, coffee, atmosphere, energy, focus, parenting). The breadth metric is not accurately reflecting the conceptual diversity extracted.
recommendations.fix: FIXED: DepthBreadthBalanceScorer now has proper breadth calculation with coverage_state.elements_seen and fallback to node type diversity. Session file predates fix.

recommendations.issue: Graph has insufficient edges (only 4 edges from 18 nodes)
recommendations.detail: The knowledge graph extracted 18 nodes with appropriate MEC categorization (attribute  functional_consequence  psychosocial_consequence  instrumental_value  terminal_value), but only 4 edges were created (22% connectivity). Missing explicit links include: milk froth  smooth coffee, smooth  energized, energized  focused, focused  doing best, etc.
recommendations.fix: STILL REAL: Bead interview-system-v2-1lp created to improve edge extraction to achieve 50%+ connectivity. Need to update extraction prompts to be more aggressive about causal relationships.

recommendations.issue: Session exceeded configured phase turns (20 turns vs 11 configured)
recommendations.detail: The interview_config.yaml specifies 4 exploratory + 6 focused + 1 closing = 11 total turns, but this session ran for 20 turns. The max_turns: 22 in config.yaml was overriding the phase-based calculation. This caused the interview to continue well beyond the intended closing phase.
recommendations.fix: FIXED: interview_config.yaml now omits max_turns (line 17) to trigger auto-calculation from phases (4+6+1=11). sync_max_turns_with_phases validator handles calculation.

recommendations.issue: No dynamic termination when terminal values reached
recommendations.detail: The session successfully reached terminal values (terminal_value nodes: 'set positive example', 'inspire others', 'read book to my kids', 'help them to grow') on turns 14-19, but continued probing until turn 20. The system should recognize terminal value achievement as a natural completion point.
recommendations.fix: STILL REAL: ContinuationStage only checks max_turns and close strategy (line 128 has TODO). Bead interview-system-v2-sa8 created to add terminal_value detection in should_close() logic.
